intro: Hieracium capillans, commonly known as the slender hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and meadows, preferring well-drained soils. It produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months, and its leaves are generally hairy and lance-shaped. Hieracium capillans is often found in disturbed habitats and can spread through rhizomes, making it a common weed in some regions.
